title: 111_hr5705
content: The "Electric Vehicle Advancement Act of 2010" may increase the credit amount for 2- and 3-wheeled electric highway vehicles. The Electric Vehicle Advancement Act of 2010 proposes amendments to section 30 of the Internal Revenue Code, allowing a tax credit for qualified plug-in electric vehicles, including 2- or 3-wheeled vehicles meeting specific criteria. The Electric Vehicle Advancement Act of 2010 proposes tax credits for qualified plug-in electric vehicles, with specific dollar limitations based on vehicle type and cost. The Electric Vehicle Advancement Act of 2010 proposes tax credits for qualified plug-in electric vehicles, with specific dollar limitations based on vehicle type and cost. Section 30 of the Code is amended to include a new paragraph defining a 2- or 3-wheeled motor vehicle with specific criteria for certification. The Electric Vehicle Advancement Act of 2010 proposes tax credits for qualified plug-in electric vehicles based on specific criteria. Section 30 of the Code is amended to include new paragraphs regarding miles per gallon equivalent and limitations on the number of eligible 2- and 3-wheeled vehicles. The Electric Vehicle Advancement Act of 2010 proposes tax credits for qualified plug-in electric vehicles based on specific criteria, including limitations on the number of eligible 2- and 3-wheeled vehicles during a phaseout period. The Electric Vehicle Advancement Act of 2010 proposes tax credits for qualified plug-in electric vehicles based on specific criteria, including limitations on the number of eligible vehicles during a phaseout period. The applicable percentage for the phaseout period is 50% for the first 2 quarters, 25% for the next 2 quarters, and 0% thereafter. Rules similar to controlled groups apply. Effective date is after the enactment of the Act.
